metadata.Title: CVE-2022-33068 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow in the component hb-ot-shape-fallback.cc of Harfbuzz v4.3.0 allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33068` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-harfbuzz-0.0 - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.1
libharfbuzz-bin - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.1
libharfbuzz-gobject0 - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.1
libharfbuzz-icu0 - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.1
libharfbuzz0b - 2.7.4-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> openjdk-lts builds with the system harfbuzz ebarretto> openjdk-17 builds with the system harfbuzz sbeattie> openjdk-8 does not use harfbuzz

criterions.comment: harfbuzz package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.4-1ubuntu3.1').
qt6-base package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
